verb.description: Separate or cause to separate into curds or lumps.
examples: take care not to let the soup boil or it will curdle

phrases: And what we get is responses that just make your blood curdle when you get them back.
The '68 original remains the one to make your blood curdle.
It's just that the idea of you with someone else, it makes my blood curdle.
Some of them made my blood curdle.
Their eyebrows light up and their eyes shift back and forth in a way that made my blood curdle.
origin: Late 16th century: frequentative of obsolete curd congeal.
